abstract.p: Melinda White letter recounts her experience during delayed connecting flight aboard United Airlines from Chicago to Burlington, Vt; United spokesman Chris Nardella replies (S)

block.p: The Travel section receives hundreds of letters from readers about their experiences with airline travel. Although most write to complain, a small number actually offer words of praise. Here is a selection from the last year:

To the Editor: My connecting United Airlines flight from Chicago to Burlington, Vt., last July was delayed for half an hour because of a ''missing cargo door piece.'' The delay overlapped a storm, which further delayed us for nearly four hours. The flight attendants then informed us that there was a shortage of food, so nine passengers did not even receive pretzels or peanuts.

The Travel section receives hundreds of letters from readers about their experiences with airline travel. Although most write to complain, a small number actually offer words of praise. Here is a selection from the last year:

To the Editor: My connecting United Airlines flight from Chicago to Burlington, Vt., last July was delayed for half an hour because of a ''missing cargo door piece.'' The delay overlapped a storm, which further delayed us for nearly four hours. The flight attendants then informed us that there was a shortage of food, so nine passengers did not even receive pretzels or peanuts.

We started sharing food and I dug up peanuts from a Southwest Airlines flight (since they give every passenger two bags). It was like the scene from ''Road Warrior'' where Mel Gibson was opening up dog food for survival.
(Ms. White later received a $100 voucher for future travel and a letter of apology from United.)

Chris Nardella, a United spokeswoman, replies: As is the case each and every day, the safety of our customers is always our top priority. As a result of situations such as Ms. White's, we have equipped all of our aircraft with extended delay kits. These kits include 200 Quaker Oatmeal nutrition bars, two bottles of Pedialyte, a beverage for infants, and extra trash bags. The kits were added in December 1999.
